meanings.definition: A person or thing that energizes or gives energy.
meanings.sent1: The coach was the energizers of the team, always motivating them to do their best.
meanings.sent2: Music can be a great energizers during a workout, keeping you pumped up.
meanings.sent3: The energetic puppy was the energizers of the household, bringing joy and excitement to everyone.
meanings.sent4: Laughter is the best energizers, lifting spirits and brightening days.
meanings.sent5: Positive affirmations can be powerful energizers, boosting confidence and motivation.

meanings.definition: A type of battery used to power electronic devices.
meanings.sent1: Make sure to always carry spare energizers for your remote control.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight needed new energizers to shine brightly in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The toy car's energizers ran out, causing it to stop moving suddenly.
meanings.sent4: The energizers in the smoke alarm need to be replaced regularly to ensure safety.
meanings.sent5: The camera wouldn't turn on until fresh energizers were inserted.

meanings.definition: A type of food or drink that provides a quick burst of energy.
meanings.sent1: Athletes often consume energy bars as quick energizers before a game.
meanings.sent2: A banana is a natural energizers that can help you stay alert and focused.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate bar was her go-to energizers during long study sessions.
meanings.sent4: The coffee served as her morning energizers, giving her the boost she needed to start the day.
meanings.sent5: Fresh fruit smoothies are refreshing energizers that can be enjoyed on a hot day.
